subject: Cybersecurity
title: Responsible Disclosure: The 90-Day Dilemma
description: A micro-lesson that makes Responsible Disclosure: The 90-Day Dilemma usable.

hook.text: You discover a bug that exposes millions of users. Do you tell the company privately and wait, or go public to force.

buildup.text: Responsible disclosure means reporting vulnerabilities to the vendor first and giving them time to fix before.

discovery.text: Google's Project Zero gives vendors 90 days. If no patch is released, the vulnerability goes public â€” fixed or not.

twist.text: In 2015, Project Zero disclosed a Windows vulnerability after 90 days. Microsoft was furious â€“ but it motivated.

climax.text: Disclosure deadlines create healthy pressure. Without them, vendors can quietly ignore vulnerabilities for years.

punchline.text: 90 days to fix it. Or the world finds out anyway.

quiz.question: Why do security researchers set disclosure deadlines?
options: To pressure vendors to fix vulnerabilities rather than ignoring them indefinitely
